name: Begum Khaleda Zia

activities.title: Anti-Ershad Movement
activities.description: Led opposition against military rule, detained multiple times

activities.title: Post-Release Speech
activities.description: Addressed nation after release from prison

activities.title: Election Discussions

controversies.title: Corruption Cases (Zia Orphanage Trust)
controversies.details: Convicted, sentenced to 5 years; released 2024 amid political changes

overallSummary: Begum Khaleda Zia, born 15 August 1945 inота Jalpaiguri (now Dinajpur, Bangladesh), is the Chairperson of BNP and former Prime Minister (1991-1996, 2001-2006). Educated at Dinajpur Girls' School and Surendranath College without a formal degree, she joined BNP in 1982 after her husband Ziaur Rahman's assassination, becoming Chairperson in 1984. She led anti-Ershad movements in the 1980, implemented educational reform, and guided BNP to electoral wins in 1991 (140 seats from Dinajpur-3) and 2001 (193 seats). Widowed with two children, she faced corruption controversies like Zia Orphanage Trust case, imprisoned 2018-2024, released amid 2024 changes. Highlights include being Bangladesh's first woman PM and 'Mother of Democracy'; recent activities involve 2025 election talks.

recentActivities.title: Khaleda Zia meets interim govt on polls
BNP chief acquitted in graft case

name: Tarique Rahman
designations: Former Minister of State for Health

activities.title: Election Campaigns
activities.description: Coordinated BNP efforts for mother's wins

activities.title: Reform Meetings
activities.description: Discussed with Yunus on caretaker govt

controversies.title: Graft and Sedition Cases
controversies.details: Convicted in multiple, sentenced to life; all acquitted 2024-2025

overallSummary: Tarique Rahman, born 20 November 1965 in Dhaka, Bangladesh, is Acting Chairperson of BNP, married to Dr. Zubaida Rahman with one child. Educated at BAF Shaheen School, St. Joseph, and University of Dhaka (incomplete International Relations), he joined BNP in 1988, elected MP from Bogura-7 in 2001, and became Senior Vice-Chairman in 2004. As Minister of State for Health, he coordinated campaigns and announced Vision 2030 in 2017. In exile since 2008, he leads from London, acquitted in all cases 2024-2025. Highlights: opposition strategist; activities include 2025 reform talks and grassroots work.

name: Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir
designations: Former State Minister for Civil Aviation & Tourism

timeline.event: MP Thakurgaon-1, Minister of State for Agriculture
Auditor for Govt and UNESCO projects

activities.title: Meeting with Yunus
activities.description: Discussed impartial administration for Feb polls

overallSummary: Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir, born 26 January 1948 in Thakurgaon, Bangladesh, is BNP Secretary General. A Dhaka College and University of Dhaka Economics graduate, he was a 1960s Chhatra Union activist, taught at Dhaka College from 1972, and audited govt projects in 1986. Elected Thakurgaon Municipality Chairman in 1988 and MP from Thakurgaon-1 in 2001 (Minister for Agriculture, Civil Aviation), he became Secretary General in 2016. Activities include leading 2010s protest, supporting 2024 quota reform, and 2025 poll talks with Yunus. Highlights: spokesperson role; controversies: 2011 attack survival.

name: Salauddin Ahmed

timeline.event: Re-elected MP, State Minister for Communication

controversies.title: Disappearance 2015
controversies.details: Vanished, recovered in India; exile till 2024

overallSummary: Salauddin Ahmed, born 30 June 1962 in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, former State Minister for Communication, and ex-MP from Cox's Bazar-1 (1996-2006). With no detailed academic background, his career includes 1996 and 2001 elections from Cox's Bazar-1. Exiled in India from 2015-2024 after a mysterious disappearance, he returned in August 2024. Activities: 2025 alliance talk, candidate nods for 200 seat, caution advisories. Highlights: 2001 ministerial role; controversies: 2015 vanishing.

name: Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain
designations: Former Cabinet Minister for Health & Civil Aviation

timeline.event: Elected MP Comilla-2, Minister of Health
Joined University of Dhaka as Professor

overallSummary: Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain, born 1 October 1946 in Goyeshpur, Comilla, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, founder, and former Health & Civil Aviation Minister. MSc Geology from Dhaka University, he joined as Professor in 1968 and was BIISS Director General 2007. Founded BNP in 1978, elected MP Comilla-2 in 1991 & 2001. Activities: ideology role, 2025 meeting, August 2025 return from London. Highlights: dual academic-political career; no major controversies.

name: Mirza Abbas
overallSummary: Mirza Abba, born 7 February 1951 in Kishoreganj, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member and former MP Dhaka-8. BSc from Dhaka University, he founded BNP in 1978, led Jubo Dal Dhaka in 1980, and won Dhaka-8 in 1991. Activities: 2025 campaigning, boycotts. Highlights: youth leadership; controversies: 2018 charges acquitted 2024.

name: Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury
overallSummary: Amir Khasru Mahmud Chowdhury, born 16 April 1963 in Chittagong, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, former Commerce Minister, and ex-MP Chittagong-9. LLB from Dhaka University via Chittagong College, elected 1996 & 2001 from Chittagong-9. Activities: 2010s protest, 2025 delay warning, Yunus talks. Highlights: family legacy; controversies: graft acquittals.

name: Nazrul Islam Khan
overallSummary: Nazrul Islam Khan, born 15 November 1948 in Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member and former polls coordinator. No academic details available; career includes 1990s MP election and 2024 committee role. Activities: May 2025 election push, advisory duties. Highlights: strategy focus; no controversies.

name: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan
overallSummary: Dr. Abdul Moyeen Khan, born 1 January 1947 in Narsingdi, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, former Science Minister, and ex-MP Narsingdi-2. MBBS from Dhaka University, joined BNP 1980, minister 2001. Activities: 2025 youth call, independence talk, faction warnings. Highlights: medical-politics blend; no controversies.

name: Altaf Hossain Chowdhury
overallSummary: Altaf Hossain Chowdhury, born 22 October 1941 in Parbatipur, Dinajpur, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, former Home Minister, and ex-Air Force Chief. No academic details; retired Air Vice Marshal 1995, joined BNP, minister 2001 from Patuakhali-1. Activities: rights work, advisory 2024. Highlights: military legacy; controversies: 2007 arrest.

name: Abdul Awal Mintoo
overallSummary: Abdul Awal Mintoo, born 22 February 1949 in Feni, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member and former Vice Chairman. Educated at Feni Pilot High, Comilla Victoria, SUNY (Masters 2023), he led FBCCI and businesses. Political: 1990s Vice Chairman, 2024 committee. Activities: advisory, tycoon role. Highlights: age 74 degree; controversies: 2013 accusations.

name: Nitai Roy Chowdhury
overallSummary: Nitai Roy Chowdhury, born 7 January 1949 in Hatbaria, Magura, Bangladesh, is BNP Standing Committee Member, Vice Chairman, former Minister & MP Magura-2. LLB educated, joined 1980, elected 1991 & 2001. Activities: 2024 rights push, advisory. Highlights: legal background; no controversies.

name: Ismail Zabihullah
overallSummary: Ismail Zabihullah, birth details unknown, is BNP Standing Committee Member. Career: 1990s MP election. Activities: 2024 advisory. Limited data available.

name: Ruhul Kabir Rizvi
overallSummary: Ruhul Kabir Rizvi, from Rangpur, Bangladesh, is BNP Senior Joint Secretary General. Joined 1980, appointed 2016. Activities: rallie, 2024 critique, boycott campaigns. Highlights: vocal role; no controversies.

name: Asaduzzaman Ripon
overallSummary: Asaduzzaman Ripon is BNP Vice Chairman, promoted 2024. Limited details; activities: reform involvement.

name: Zahir Uddin Swapan
overallSummary: Zahir Uddin Swapan, born 29 June 1960 in Barisal, is BNP Advisory Council Member and former MP Barisal-1. Career: 1990s election, 2024 council. Activities: media, boycotts. Highlights: comms role.

name: Mahbub Uddin Khokon
overallSummary: Mahbub Uddin Khokon, born 12 January 1956 in Noakhali, is BNP Advisory Council Member, Joint SG, ex-MP Noakhali-1. Barrister from England, elected 1990, SG 2016, promoted 2024. Activities: legal work, reforms. Highlights: 25+ years litigation.

name: Mojibur Rahman Sarwar
overallSummary: Mojibur Rahman Sarwar, born 1954 in Barisal, is BNP Advisory Council Member, former Barisal Mayor & MP Barisal-5 (1991,1998,2001,2008). Career: elected multiple, promoted 2024. Activities: local, reforms. Highlights: consistent wins.

name: Syed Moazzem Hossain Alal

timeline.event: Joint SG to Advisory, released from jail

overallSummary: Syed Moazzem Hossain Alal, born 31 December 1955 in Barisal, is BNP Advisory Council Member, Joint SG, ex-MP Barisal-2. LLB lawyer, elected 1990, promoted 2024. Activities: youth past, post-jail 2024. Highlights: dal leadership; controversies: 2023 detention.

name: Lion Aslam Chowdhury
overallSummary: Lion Aslam Chowdhury, FCA, is BNP Advisory Council Member, former Joint SG. Accountant-industrialist-human rights activist, promoted 2024. Activities: ongoing advocacy, 2025 praise. Highlights: multi-faceted; no controversies.

name: Barrister Mahbub Uddin Khokon
overallSummary: Barrister Mahbub Uddin Khokon, born 12 January 1956 in Noakhali, is BNP Joint SG, ex-MP Noakhali-1. Barrister, appointed 2016. Limited activities; highlights: legal career.

overallSummary: Major General (Retd) Md Sharif Uddin is BNP Advisory Council Member, nominated 2025. Former BIISS DG 2007. Limited details; highlights: military background.

name: Shama Obaid
overallSummary: Shama Obaid is BNP Special Assistant for Foreign Policy, Organizing Secretary, 2008 Faridpur-2 candidate. Daughter of ex-minister, activities: 2025 critique, 2022 diplomacy. Highlights: gender role.
